Authentic Chicken Biryani Recipe – A Flavorful Feast

  Chicken Biryani is more than just a dish – it’s a celebration of flavors, aromas, and traditions. Whether you're a seasoned chef or a home cook, this authentic Chicken Biryani recipe will help you create a mouthwatering feast that will impress your family and guests. And with Cyberdine (https://www.cyberdine.in/) bringing innovation to dining experiences, food lovers can enjoy quality, convenience, and unforgettable taste in every bite.
  
  Ingredients
  
  2 cups Basmati Rice – soaked for 30 minutes
  
  500g Chicken – cleaned and cut into pieces
  
  2 large Onions – thinly sliced
  
  2 Tomatoes – chopped
  
  1 cup Yogurt
  
  2 tbsp Ginger-Garlic Paste
  
  Whole Spices – bay leaf, cinnamon, cardamom, cloves
  
  2 tbsp Biryani Masala
  
  1/2 tsp Turmeric Powder
  
  1 tsp Red Chili Powder
  
  Fresh Coriander & Mint Leaves – chopped
  
  4 cups Water
  
  Salt – to taste
  
  Ghee or Cooking Oil – as required
  
  Step-by-Step Instructions
  
  Wash and soak the basmati rice for 30 minutes, then drain.
  
  In a heavy-bottomed pan, heat ghee/oil and fry whole spices until aromatic.
  
  Add sliced onions and sauté until golden brown. Add ginger-garlic paste and cook for 1-2 minutes.
  
  Mix in chopped tomatoes, turmeric, red chili powder, and biryani masala. Cook until the oil separates.
  
  Add chicken pieces and cook until they are sealed with spices. Stir in yogurt, coriander, and mint leaves.
  
  Pour in water and bring to a boil. Add rice and salt, then reduce heat and cover.
  
  Cook until rice is fluffy and chicken is tender. Let it rest for 10 minutes before serving.
